Norev 800107 Mitsubishi Pajero 1985 Dakar Rally Winner P. Zaniroli/J. Da Silva

Purchased: 2011

First Dakar win for Patrick Zaniroli.
First Dakar win for Mitsubishi.
First Dakar win for Pajero.

In 1985 the Pajero celebrated the first in a long series of Dakar victories. 12 to be exact, more than any other manufacturer.

The Dakar adventure started very modestly for Mitsubishi. In 1983 a privately entered Pajero driven by Andrew Cowan and Colin Malkin finished in 11th place overall. The following year the Pajero driven by Andrew Cowan finished 3rd with substantial support from Mitsubishi. For 1985 Mitsubishi again provided support, entering 3 Pajeros carefully prepared by Sonauto, the French importer of the brand in the Paris area. The Pajero was now finally a real contender: its weight was reduced to 1,350 kilograms (down from 1,600 kilograms in 1983), the turbocharged 2.6L fuel-injected 4 cylinder was now good for 220 hp (up from 103 hp in 1983) and top speed was increased to 180 km/h (up from 140 km/h in 1983). Now much faster and more powerful, the Pajero fortunately retained its strength and reliability. Based on the short frame of the standard Pajero model it was also very agile.

This was the beginning of a long history marked by success for Mitsubishi and its off-road racer. But even before this victory the Pajero was already considered a car made for the Dakar. No less than 37 teams had lined up for the start of the 1985 edition in one...
